data.title: bd-3vh2: Port triage and iteration-start scripts to Rust
data.description:
Ported two utility scripts from Node.js to Rust. Both are pure formatting/aggregation commands with no side effects.

## Changes
- Added src/commands/triage.rs (186 lines + tests)
- Added src/commands/iteration_start.rs (325 lines + tests)
- Updated src/commands/mod.rs to export new modules
- Updated src/commands/run.rs with handler implementations
- Fixed hooks/mod.rs unused exports

## Triage
Wraps bv --robot-triage and formats output with:
- Triage summary (counts)
- Top picks (up to 5)
- Blockers to clear
- Quick wins
- Recommendations (up to 6 with reason)
- Project health metrics
- ANSI colored output
- Helpful command hint

## IterationStart
Aggregates four data sources:
1. Inbox messages (unread count + previews)
2. Ready beads (open/unblocked with priority/owner)
3. Pending reviews (awaiting votes, threads with responses)
4. Active claims (resource claims, filtered for clarity)

Loads config with fallback, handles tool failures gracefully, suggests next action.

## Testing
- 11 unit tests all passing
- Triage: 3 tests (parse full/minimal, colors)
- IterationStart: 8 tests (parse inbox/beads/reviews/claims, filter claims, truncate, colors)
- Both commands tested manually and work correctly

No behavior changes, only new functionality.

data.reason:
Security review complete. No security concerns found.

These are pure read-only formatting commands with no user input, no auth, no network operations, and no file writes. Command injection is prevented via workspace name validation. All subprocess invocation uses safe array-based args. Output is properly bounded. Dependencies are standard and safe.

LGTM for merge.
